org.apache.spark.unsafe.bitset

Class BitSetMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.spark.unsafe.bitset.BitSetMethods

  • public final class BitSetMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods for working with fixed-size uncompressed bitsets. We assume that the bitset data is word-aligned (that is, a multiple of 8 bytes in length). Each bit occupies exactly one bit of storage.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      Returns the index of the first bit that is set to true that occurs on or after the specified starting index.

      Sets the bit at the specified index to true.
      static void unset(java.lang.Object baseObject, long baseOffset, int index)

      • nextSetBit

        public static int nextSetBit(java.lang.Object baseObject,
                             long baseOffset,
                             int fromIndex,
                             int bitsetSizeInWords)
        Returns the index of the first bit that is set to true that occurs on or after the specified starting index. If no such bit exists then -1 is returned.

        To iterate over the true bits in a BitSet, use the following loop: 

         
  for (long i = bs.nextSetBit(0, sizeInWords); i >= 0;
    i = bs.nextSetBit(i + 1, sizeInWords)) {
    // operate on index i here
  }
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - the index to start checking from (inclusive)
        bitsetSizeInWords - the size of the bitset, measured in 8-byte words
        Returns:
        the index of the next set bit, or -1 if there is no such bit
